results.title: Secrets of the heart
results.creator_credit: Edwin Hill and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
Narrated by Richard Morecroft and presented by Steve Morton, this beautifully photographed documentary takes a critical look at the “dead heart” of Australia, the desert areas of the Northern Territory. They are revealed as a complex and subtle environment under threat from cattle grazing and poor land management techniques.

results.title: The King of comedy
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Arnon Milchan and Embassy International Pictures
results.brief_description: Rupert Pupkin (Robert De Niro), is an aspiring comedian obsessed with TV talk show host, Jerry Langford (Jerry Lewis). After co-ordinating a meeting with his idol, Rupert tells Langford about the comedy material he has written. Langford is as charming as he is dismissive, and after being repeatedly rejected and eventually ejected by Langford’s staff, Rupert decides to take matters into his own hands, conspiring a sensationally irresponsible scheme to beat defeat. The ‘King of Comedy’ is widely seen as Martin Scorsese’s cynically black-comic reaction to the media firestorm that followed his 1976 film ‘Taxi Driver’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Scorsese, Arnon Milchan and Embassy International Pictures

results.title: The Lacemaker = La Dentelliere
results.creator_credit: Claude Goretta, Yves Gasser, Yves Peyrot, Citel Films, Filmproduktion Janus and Action Films
results.brief_description: Pomme works as a hairdresser and lives with her protective mother in Paris. She goes on a holiday to the seaside town of Cabourg with a more worldly friend. There she forms a relationship with Francois, a young student, and they decide to live together in Paris. Social differences soon emerge. While Francois is garrulously intellectual, Pomme is reserved, incapable of communicating with Francois and his friends but maintaining a mysterious inner radiance. Goretta has described his film as “a genre painting” in narrative form and it is constructed in a series of brief fragmentary scenes which form a picture without evident narrative connections. With its narrative ellipses - eloquent silences and observation of Pomme’s mysterious inner life - Goretta’s film resembles Bresson’s “Une Femme Douce”. Cast includes Isabelle Huppert, Yves Benneyton, Florence Giorgetti, and Anne-Marie Duringer. Based on the novel by Pascal Laine. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: A Brush with nature, Robert Ulmann
results.creator_credit: Toni Steinbrecher, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
The return of the southern right whale to Australia’s southern coast is observed and recorded in the art of Swiss-Australian wildlife artist, Robert Ulmann. He has found a new life in an area that most Australians would avoid as desolate, dangerous and bleak.

results.title: The Koala quandry
results.creator_credit: John Muirhead, Dione Gilmour and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
An examination of the feeding and habitat of the koala, the likely survival of the species in the face of environmental and biological threats is discussed.

results.title: The King and I
results.creator_credit: Walter Lang, Charles Brackett and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This visual and musical masterpiece features Yul Brynner’s Academy Award winning performance, an unforgettable Rodgers and Hammerstein score, and brilliant choreography by Jerome Robbins. It tells the true story of an Englishwoman, Anna Leonowens who comes to Siam as a school teacher to the royal court in the 1860’s. Winner of five Academy Awards, “The King and I” contains some of the most lavish sets and costumes in Hollywood history, and some of the world’s best loved songs. Also stars Deborah Kerr.

results.title: The King's life guard
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Realist Films
results.brief_description: The ceremony of the Changing of the Guard. Shows the preparation of the household cavalry at the Royal barracks and stables followed by the procession and finally the actual ceremony.

results.title: The Krays
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, Ray Burdis, Dominic Anciano and Fugitive Features
results.brief_description: Growing up in the East End of London during World War 2, the Kray twins became the heads of London’s gangster underworld in the 1960’s. After their release from prison during their teens, the Krays consolidated their underworld connections and “The Firm” was born. Ruling through fear, extortion and violence, the Kray’s empire dominated the crime world for years. Finally in 1969, they were convicted of murder and separated in prison. At their beloved mother’s death in 1982, they were briefly reunited before returning to prison. A compelling film biography.

results.title: Raising Archie
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
Describes the habitat and adaptive behaviour of a colony of grey-headed flying foxes in suburban Sydney.
